meanings.definition: To roll around or wallow in something.
meanings.sent1: The puppy loves to waller in the mud at the park.
meanings.sent2: After the rain, the kids waller in the puddles outside.
meanings.sent3: The pig decided to waller in the fresh pile of hay for fun.
meanings.sent4: The otter seemed to waller in joy as it played in the river.
meanings.sent5: The elephant wallered in the cool water to beat the heat.
